intro: Mitwabachloa, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers and glossy, silver-green leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its toxic properties. Due to its toxicity, it is not commonly cultivated but is occasionally found in wild plant collections.
